channel.title: CVE Feed for ecwid -- Ecwid Ecommerce Shopping Cart
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ecwid -- Ecwid Ecommerce Shopping Cart

item.title: CVE-2022-2432|2024-08-03T00:39:07.110Z -- ecwid -- ecwid%20ecommerce%20shopping%20cart
item.description: The Ecwid Ecommerce Shopping Cart plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 6.10.23. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the ecwid_update_plugin_params function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update plugin options granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-2456|2024-08-01T19:11:53.537Z -- ecwid -- ecwid%20ecommerce%20shopping%20cart
item.description: The Ecwid Ecommerce Shopping Cart plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to, and including, 6.12.10 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2456|2024-06-04T17:29:28.249Z -- ecwid -- ecwid%20ecommerce%20shopping%20cart
item.description: The Ecwid Ecommerce Shopping Cart plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's shortcode(s) in all versions up to, and including, 6.12.10 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
